content:
Thomas Tusser

Ere stopping or turning, to put forth a hande
Is a charm that thy daies may be long in the land.

Though seventy-times-seven thee Fortune befriend,
O'ertaking at corners is Death in the end.

Sith main-roads for side-roads care nothing, have care
Both to slow and to blow when thou interest there.

Drink as thou canst hold it, but after is best;
For Drink with men's Driving makes Crowners to Quest.
cleaned: thomas tusser ere stopping or turning put forth a hande a charm that thy daies may be long the land though seventy times seven thee fortune befriend o ertaking corners death the end sith main roads side roads care nothing care both slow and blow when thou interest there drink as thou canst hold it but is best drink with men s driving makes crowners quest
